title: Japan Producer Price Inflation MoM
description: Producer Price Inflation MoM in Japan decreased to 0.60 percent in October from 0.70 percent in September of 2022. Producer Price Inflation MoM in Japan averaged 0.12 percent from 1960 until 2022, reaching an all time high of 7.40 percent in December of 1973 and a record low of -1.90 percent in October of 2008. In Japan, the Producer Price Inflation MoM measures a month-over-month change in the price of goods and services sold by manufacturers and producers in the wholesale market. This page includes a chart with historical data for Japan Producer Price Inflation MoM.
author: Bank of Japan
